reviews.text: Malai kofta carried soft vegetable balls in a creamy sauce paratha complemented the dish beautifully service was kind and welcoming throughout the evening
Shrimp masala had bold flavor yet stayed balanced pairing it with cucumber raita cooled the spice nicely making the experience both satisfying and refreshing

Curry Heights gave me a relaxing evening with samosas that were crisp and flavorful followed by chicken tikka masala rich and comforting staff kept things flowing smoothly making the meal easy to enjoy
Papadom was light and crispy, perfect start before the meal.
Enjoyable meal, cozy design, and authentic taste.
Amazing service with quality food and affordable prices.
Dal makhani was creamy and full of flavor, and poori on side was perfectly puffed. This kind of food makes you feel cared for. Dining here is always a pleasure.
Vegetable jalfrezi had just right kick, and garlic naan was a perfect match. Service was smooth, and meal left me smiling as I left.
Chana masala with roti was satisfying, and staff made sure I was comfortable throughout. It‚Äôs kind of place that makes dining out easy and enjoyable.
Grilled salmon was light yet flavorful, followed by vegetable korma with rice. Each bite was enjoyable, and service made whole dinner even better.
I enjoyed broccoli malai appetizer and paneer naan with vegetable curry. Everything tasted good, and overall experience felt warm and pleasant.

More people need to visit this restaurant!
It‚Äôs serves very fresh curries and rice
The Naan is delectable
We ordered the fish curry and lamb, tikka masala, garlic, naan, and spinach naan
Hundred percent  recommended
My Indian friend came with me and she gave it to the seal of approval!

I‚Äôve visited this restaurant twice since it‚Äôs close to my college, but my experience hasn‚Äôt been good. The first time, the food was okay, though the air conditioning wasn‚Äôt working and the place felt disorganized I decided to give them another chance thinking maybe it was just a bad day.
Unfortunately, my second visit was even worse. The food quality had gone down a lot I got a really bad stomach ache afterward, and the naan tasted like it was frozen and reheated. For the prices they charge, the taste and freshness just don‚Äôt match up. The restaurant was uncomfortably hot again, and there was a strange smell inside that made it hard to enjoy the meal.
Overall, I‚Äôd only recommend going here if you can‚Äôt find any other nearby option.
Stop harassing people with this kind of food who prepares biryani with tamarind in it do not visit this restaurant if you ever wanna have your taste buds intact

We were a group of 4 who went for lunch. The food was unfortunately disappointing and not worth the price. On top of that, the restaurant added an 18% gratuity to our bill without informing us. While the menu mentioned that gratuity would be applied, it did not specify for how many people it would apply ‚Äî which is very misleading. Typically, automatic gratuity is reserved for larger groups (like 6 or more), so this felt unfair and not transparent. For the quality of food and service we received, we did not feel this was justified. Clear communication and fair billing are important.

The food was very disappointing. We ordered a kachori chaat, but it was served cold. On top of that, they added an 18% gratuity to the bill even though we were just four people. Not a good experience overall

The food was below average and didn‚Äôt meet our expectations. What really disappointed us was the automatic 18% gratuity added to the bill ‚Äî even though we were just a group of three. It felt unfair to be charged extra f

Don't order from them!
They don't deliver all the meals and then hide behind Doordash
Used a array of vulgar words when I called them for the chicken tikka masala üê•
Fresh herbs add bright taste and aroma to meals.

Not sure what happened this time.  I've purchased the garlic naan for years whenever i'm downtown brooklyn.  Yesterday, my while I was enjoying the beautiful waterfront of the Brooklyn Promenades, my daughter called and asked that I purchase a few for her.  I obliged, orderd 3 galic naan's.  I was initally advised it'll take about 10 minutes but it came out faster. I was thrilled, until I got home and opened the order.  The naans were burnt, the garlic burnt.  I'm not sure that happened but my daughter and myself was not happy.   I'll give a second chance whenever i'm back downtown, since this is the first occurrence.  I hope I won't be disappointed next time.
No trata bien ah la gente üëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèª‚Ä¶
Meals remain affordable without compromising taste or service.
Team shows real professionalism while still being friendly.
The only thing I liked about this place was the onion pakoda and the chutney they served. Everything else was just average.
Lunch special - I think the before and after speaks for itself! üòãüòãüòã
Leckeres Essen zu super Preisen und das Personal ist sehr freundlich!

Amazing food, though I should've picked the non spicy option for my white friend.
If you're bringing your white friend, make sure you've toughened out their spice tolerance before introducing to the spicy biryani
great food and very friendly service!
The lamb tikka was perfectly cooked and very flavorful.
Curry Heights has the best lunch specials in Downtown Brooklyn. Affordable and delicious.
Curry Heights has the best mango lassi in Brooklyn. Thick, sweet, and refreshing.

I came from canada i had a worst experience in this restaurant we ordered chicken tikka masala and garlic naan, The garlic naan looks like they get from walmart and my brother ask to change a cutlery and service guy response was why you want to change with new old one is nice worst experience, request from owner to give some training to your employee.
They add 18% gratuity automatically and add 3% on top of that if you pay by card. They don‚Äôt tell you this ahead of time.
It is one of the worst food you ll ever taste in ny‚Ä¶i asked waiter for cutlery and his reply was can you use old one and not only this they need to change there chef‚Ä¶ worst experience

The service was not good at all!
The food was ok
Curry Heights has a fantastic vegetarian menu. The veg flat rice was light, tasty, and filling.
The tandoori chicken was juicy, smoky, and packed with flavor. This is now my favorite Indian restaurant near Brooklyn Law School.
The salad was surprisingly crisp and refreshing.
Extremely filling ‚Äî I had leftovers for later.
The texture and taste were so smooth and refined.
Bold flavors and bold choices ‚Äî in the best way!
Nice service
Always so neat and tidy ‚Äî I appreciate that.
Food came out fast and hot. Great service.
The space was so peaceful, great for a quiet meal.
So traditional and true to its roots.
A unique gem in the area.
Everyone left the table feeling joyful and happy.
Rich in flavor and very satisfying.
Tastes amazing and very affordable too.

The food was great! We had the butter chicken and was very delicious, the rice and naan were also amazing. For an appetizer we had chicken and was blown away. The service was not great, the automatic tip was not amazing (granted I usually give 18% regardless but I prefer to put it myself). The staff didn‚Äôt really care much nor cared to elaborate on anything when asked. The mango lassi is to die for btw! I would ask management to retrain their employees for customer service cuz I would get the food here just not dine in.

Not authentic! Shocking that it‚Äôs more than 4 stars. Food was very disappointing. The paneer tikka masala tasted like paneer with tomato sauce from pasta.

They add 18% gratuity automatically and add 3% on top of that if you pay by card. They don‚Äôt tell you this ahead of time.

Nestled unassumingly on Remsen Street in Brooklyn, Curry Heights offers a delightful foray into the rich tapestry of Indian cuisine. The restaurant‚Äôs commitment to authentic flavors is evident from the first bite to the last.

The Chicken Tikka Masala stands out, boasting tender morsels bathed in a creamy, tomato-based sauce that strikes a harmonious balance between spice and sweetness. Equally compelling is the Lamb Biryani, where fragrant basmati rice intermingles with succulent lamb, infused with aromatic herbs and spices that evoke the essence of traditional Indian cooking.

Vegetarian offerings are no less impressive. The Saag Paneer presents a luscious blend of spinach and paneer cheese, seasoned with garlic and herbs to elevate its earthy profile. Meanwhile, the Aloo Motor Gobi combines cauliflower, potatoes, and green peas in a medley that is both comforting and flavorful.

The ambiance at Curry Heights is inviting, providing a cozy setting that complements the culinary experience. Service is attentive yet unobtrusive, ensuring that diners feel welcomed and well-cared-for throughout their meal.

In a city teeming with dining options, Curry Heights distinguishes itself by delivering consistently high-quality dishes that honor the traditions of Indian cuisine. It‚Äôs a testament to how authenticity and passion can transform a meal into a memorable dining affair.

Das Essen war wirklich der Wahnsinn. Das Naan war fantastisch und die Gerichte ebenso.
Eines der besten indischen Essen die wir je hatten!
Didn‚Äôt take too much good pictures because we eat right away!! It‚Äôs really goooood. I like their goat curry!!!

I had things to do in the area. I parked right next to the place when I finished,
my daughter asked me to eat here. We love Indian food but certain area not all of it.
They have to go plate, the food unbelievable she ordered chicken tikka masala so delicious I pick up for myself the vegetarian plate spinach with cheese,yellow lentil,and cauliflower on rice. Everything was perfect. Portion huge I couldn‚Äôt finished with mine‚Ä¶we get in the lunch special price was more then affordable.See you guys soon!

Not sure why this place has less than 5 star.. portions- BEEFY! Even if you don‚Äôt get beef.

I got a chicken curry dish recommended by the cashier and was pleasantly surprised by the serving size. The food came out within minutes of ordering, and the staff was kind and attentive. The ambience seems traditional, I went during the daytime, so there wasn‚Äôt too many people inside.

My kid brother came from out of state & we went in Manhattan. It was almost 90 degrees, we were so tired & feeling hungry. So I googled & try to find a desi halal restaurant to eat.

When I went inside only thing I liked was the paintings on the wall. The decor was kinda dull, maybe the business isn‚Äôt good. But they definitely need to renovate & redecorate the restaurant.

I was too tired to leave & try another restaurant! Do decided to eat anyway. The price was high & the taste wasn‚Äôt close at all. Me & my brother couldn‚Äôt even finish our one chicken biryani. I had to bring the other chicken biryani it home. The chicken loly pop  was ok.

Only thing I liked is the lady who served us. Really nice & helpful. I appreciated her service a lot. Even my kid brother also gave her tip.

I hope rest of the food is better then what we tasted. Feeling real bad saying all this, maybe others will like it.

For an Indian Halal restaurant, there was not much flavor. Probably the Chef will hate me after this, maybe I should remove my pictures from the reviewüò∑But it is what it is!

I was dissatisfied! My brother did mentioned that he liked the mango lassi. That‚Äôs a plus pointüôè

The food was so spicy even though we asked them for a mild one. We could not finish the food!
They charge you 18% automatically as a tip for a service that was not that much perfect, for instance, they brought water in room temperature without ice without asking costumers what they prefer.

Wir gingen in Brooklyn Heights spazieren und hatten Hunger. Da wir gerne indisch essen, fiel uns Curry Heights auf. Von drau√üen erschien es uns erst nicht sch√∂n genug, doch wir trauten uns rein und wurden positiv √ºberrascht: Das Essen hat‚Ä¶

Easily coming back here in the future to try the rest of the menu.

The lollipop chicken was top tier, the mixed vegetable & mushroom was sour and delicious.

Butter chicken curry is mouth watering and perfect with the rice. The Chicken Malai Kabab was also really great.

This restaurant is very close the metrotech center and NYU university.

The taste was just ok, not soo impressive. Samosas were good but the biryani was average.
The veg biryani and chicken biryani were in curry style, not like dum biryani.

Can try it once if you are near brooklyn bridge and wanted to try indian.

Ambience was just OK!

Had such a great dining experience at Curry Heights. The portions were generous and well-priced. We had chicken tikka biryani and mango lassi‚Äîperfectly filling for two people. The service was excellent too. Definitely coming back for more!

Good food here. I got the shrimp curry and it was quite tasty. I did think it was a little bit pricey considering the amount of shrimp they give you. The flavors were very good and not too salty. I would come back and try another dish.

2.28.23 - We didn't go for the lunch specials, which I think would have been better bang for the buck. I like their Tarka Dal, but I like the smokier version better. We also had goat curry, which was flavorful and had a good amount of meat.

Das Essen ist √ºberragend. Wirklich fantastisch und mit das beste indische Essen, das ich bisher gegessen habe. Der Service war auch sehr aufmerksam. Insgesamt ein sehr empfehlenswertes Restaurant. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gef√ºhlt.

Very delicious Indian food, good service all time, affordable prices.

My paratha was super yummy,  I love bastami rice, good portions on each dish.

Me Encanta la comida India, cada que trabajo hasta la noche decido pedir comida de este restaurante de la India por que esta cerca , la comida es muy rica, los precios son accesibles y son buenas porciones, y hacen una oarata especialmente para mi por que el aceite me causa alergia, no puedo comer comida frita, super bonuuuus para ellos.
Never knew okra could taste this good! The bhindi masala was crispy yet tender with amazing spices. Paired it with their fluffy jeera rice - absolute perfection on a plate. üòã

Did dinner around 7:30 PM as a party of two and there was only one other occupied table. We had their two-course special, which included one appetizer and the main (came with bread too).

ü•ò Got vege samosas, lamb tikka masala served with basmati rice, and something with chicken and spinach? Bread of choice was the garlic naan. Everything was hot, flavorful, and delicious.

üõéÔ∏è Service was just ok. There were many takeouts while we were there, so that speaks to quality.

I didn't know there is an Indian restaurent in the area of my college. I am a big fan of Indian foods. One day, suddenly we found out there is a place called Curry Heights. We went their to grab some snacks. It was amazing.  The foods the have are very delicious and fresh. The place is neat and clean. Stuffs are very friendly.

Great deal for curry, appetizer, and naan!

For $23 you can get a combo meal of three items, making the price very valuable. I'd recommend the vegetable samosas for the appetizer, and you can't go wrong with the garlic naan.

Four of us went for dinner on a Monday night. It was clean, neat, very quiet, and dimly lit--nice ambiance. There was also beautifully colored artwork in the walls. The service was very good. We shared the dishes we got and they all tastes the good. The lamb in the Lamb Tikka Masala was very tender. The Seafood Briyani had a good amount of seafood, was spicy, and had lots of spices. The Naan was great. Loved my Mango Lassi! I would definitely order from them again.
If I could give six stars, I would! Quiet, clean, friendly, and fast‚ÄîCurry Heights checks every box. Great for dine-in or takeout. Love this place!
Delicious and cheap, we need this kind of Indian restaurant in south Brooklyn
Had the most wonderful family dinner last night. The kids devoured the mild korma while we enjoyed the complex flavors of the goat curry. Generous portions meant leftovers for lunch today - bonus!

I have gone to this place many times for their chicken malai Kabab before the pandemic. Recently went there, the price increased by $4 and the portion of the food was a lot less than the last time I was there. The pakoras were not fresh at all. Food doesn‚Äôt taste good and overpriced.

I randomly stopped by here for their lunch special one day last month and was very impressed with the quality, price, and portion sizes. It was so good, that I had to come back for a second visit for lunch the next day! Between my two visits, I ate the chicken tikka masala, chicken vindaloo, channa Masala, and saag paneer - I was happy with each of them and would highly recommend coming here for lunch.
Too much gratuity fee just for two people dinning plus you pay extra fee for credit card use. Guy at the register has attitude issues. Not the server. Not the best experience we had.

Took my little sister to Curry Heights after a show for her first Indian meal, and it was a hit! We tried the kachori, paneer makhni with garlic naan, and chicken korma‚Äîeverything was delicious. The rice pudding at the end was the perfect touch. Highly recommend!

Today I ordered an express lunch platter for take out. It was quick, delicious, and the price was competitive. Downtown Brooklyn is a commercial district, if you are a busy person and looking for a quick but quality grab to go, this is the place for you.

The moment I walked into Curry Heights I was greeted with warm smiles. The staff's attentiveness made my dining experience delightful. Each dish burst with authentic Indian flavors and the prices were reasonable. Highly recommend
